ML Ops Engineer (100% Remote | US Shift)







Key Responsibilities:

Build and maintain scalable ML training and deployment pipelines for internal applications.
Fine-tune and optimize ML models for better performance and efficiency.
Automate model training, deployment, and monitoring workflows to ensure seamless operations.
Work with data scientists and ML engineers to optimize data pipelines and inference performance.
Develop monitoring tools to track model performance, detect drift, and trigger retraining.
Ensure AI solutions comply with security and regulatory standards (SOC 2, HIPAA, GDPR).
Manage ML infrastructure on AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for cost and performance optimization.
Implement retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) techniques and vector search databases for improved ML inference.
Handle model versioning, performance evaluation, and explainability tracking using MLflow or Weights & Biases.
Work with software engineers to integrate ML-powered APIs and microservices into business applications.
Support continuous model improvement, A/B testing, and automated performance tuning.
Document AI workflows, architectures, and key learnings to share best practices.
Stay updated on the latest ML and AI advancements to improve internal solutions.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering, with at least 1 year in MLOps and model deployment.
Hands-on experience in training, fine-tuning, and deploying ML models, including NLP and LLMs.
Proficiency with AI/ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Hugging Face Transformers.
Experience with cloud-based AI solutions like AWS SageMaker, Bedrock, Azure AI, or Google Cloud Vertex AI.
Basic knowledge of CI/CD pipelines for AI models and GitOps workflows.
Strong Python skills and experience with model-serving frameworks like FastAPI or TorchServe.
Familiarity with monitoring tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK) for AI systems.
Experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and Terraform for scalable AI deployments.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills to collaborate across teams.




Preferred (Nice to Have) Skills:

Experience with reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF).
Understanding of vector databases and embedding techniques.
Knowledge of distributed training and high-performance computing for ML.
Exposure to domain-specific ML applications for business use.

Familiarity with cost-optimization strategies for AI workloads in the cloud
